description: First attested from 1300 as Middle English merveilous, from Old French merveillus, from merveille (“a wonder”). See also marvel.

adjectives.description: marvellous (comparative more marvellous, superlative most marvellous)

entries.meaning: (British spelling) Exciting wonder or surprise; astonishing; wonderful.
examples: I went to a marvellous party last week.
